award_name.ja: 学会優秀発表賞（日本歯科審美学会）

description.en: Aim: The aim of this study was to evaluate the teaching of cariology in Japanese dental schools. Design: Postal questionnaires were sent to all Japanese dental schools. Participants: Twenty-five of the 29 Japanese dental schools (response rate: 86%). Results: The results were in many areas similar to those reported from North America. The non-surgical approach to the management of primary caries predominated, but no schools used bacteriological tests in caries diagnosis and only one school recommended antibacterial treatment. Four of the 25 responding schools advocated the treatment of primary enamel lesions by surgical intervention while three awaited operative intervention until the lesions had reached the middle third of the dentine. Recommendation of fluoride treatment was less common than in North America. The use of electronic devices to diagnose occlusal caries lesions was more common than in North America, but I explorer catch' was the most frequently used method to diagnose primary and secondary caries in dental schools in both regions. Conclusion: Research in cariology over the years has led to altered views on how and when to treat caries lesions. The interpretation of research findings and the transfer of knowledge by teachers in dental schools have an impact on the practice of operative dentistry, but the diversity in the teaching of cariology indicates that the interpretation and implementation of modern principles in the treatment of caries differ quite markedly in Japanese dental schools.

publisher.en: F D I WORLD DENTAL PRESS LTD

description.en: Aim: The aim of this study was to evaluate the teaching of cariology in Japanese dental schools. Design: Postal questionnaires were sent to all Japanese dental schools. Participants: Twenty-five of the 29 Japanese dental schools (response rate: 86%). Results: The results were in many areas similar to those reported from North America. The non-surgical approach to the management of primary caries predominated, but no schools used bacteriological tests in caries diagnosis and only one school recommended antibacterial treatment. Four of the 25 responding schools advocated the treatment of primary enamel lesions by surgical intervention while three awaited operative intervention until the lesions had reached the middle third of the dentine. Recommendation of fluoride treatment was less common than in North America. The use of electronic devices to diagnose occlusal caries lesions was more common than in North America, but I explorer catch' was the most frequently used method to diagnose primary and secondary caries in dental schools in both regions. Conclusion: Research in cariology over the years has led to altered views on how and when to treat caries lesions. The interpretation of research findings and the transfer of knowledge by teachers in dental schools have an impact on the practice of operative dentistry, but the diversity in the teaching of cariology indicates that the interpretation and implementation of modern principles in the treatment of caries differ quite markedly in Japanese dental schools.

publisher.en: F D I WORLD DENTAL PRESS LTD

paper_title.en: An ultrastructural analysis of the prototype single-step adhesive applied on enamel and dentin surfaces

description.en: A new type of self-etching agent, the single-step adhesive, was developed. The purpose of this study was to investigate the difference in the ultrastructural features of enamel and dentin surfaces following application of the prototype single-step adhesive (EXM618, 3M, MN, USA). Extracted caries-free human premolars were used in this study. Occlusal enamels of teeth - to be used as cut surface specimens - were removed perpendicular to the long axis of the specimens. The mesial and distal surfaces of these teeth, on the other hand, were used as uncut surface specimens in the test. In addition, Mega Bond (Kuraray Medical Inc., Tokyo, Japan) and Xeno CFII Bond (Dentsply Sankin, Tokyo, Japan) were used as controls. After covering half of the tooth surfaces with nail varnish (for control), the other half of each surface was treated with one of the three test adhesives - EXM618, Mega Bond, or Xeno CFII Bond - according to the manufacturer's recommendations. Conditioned enamel and dentin surfaces (i.e., decalcified depth and rugged surface) were observed with a scanning confocal laser microscope (SCLM 1100, Olympus, Tokyo, Japan; henceforth abbreviated as SCLM). Based on the findings of this study, the prototype single-step adhesive EXM618 appears to be suitable for use in dental clinics.

paper_title.en: An ultrastructural analysis of the prototype single-step adhesive applied on enamel and dentin surfaces

description.en: A new type of self-etching agent, the single-step adhesive, was developed. Extracted caries-free human premolars were used in this study. Occlusal enamels of teeth - to be used as cut surface specimens - were removed perpendicular to the long axis of the specimens. The mesial and distal surfaces of these teeth, on the other hand, were used as uncut surface specimens in the test. In addition, Mega Bond (Kuraray Medical Inc., Tokyo, Japan) and Xeno CFII Bond (Dentsply Sankin, Tokyo, Japan) were used as controls. After covering half of the tooth surfaces with nail varnish (for control), the other half of each surface was treated with one of the three test adhesives - EXM618, Mega Bond, or Xeno CFII Bond - according to the manufacturer's recommendations. Conditioned enamel and dentin surfaces (i.e., decalcified depth and rugged surface) were observed with a scanning confocal laser microscope (SCLM 1100, Olympus, Tokyo, Japan; henceforth abbreviated as SCLM). Based on the findings of this study, the prototype single-step adhesive EXM618 appears to be suitable for use in dental clinics.

paper_title.ja: 歯科用CAD/CAM CEREC 3によるオールセラミック修復物の適合性ーインターネットによる設計情報送信の影響ー

description.ja: CEREC3で,修復物設計情報を含む光学印象画像を,CADを担うイメージングユニットとCAMを行うミリングユニットの間で送受信することで製作した修復物の製作精度にインターネットを経由する情報伝達法が与える影響を検討した.今回,クラウンを支台歯に合着後セメント厚さを計測することで適合精度の比較を行った.イメージングユニットとミリングユニットをケーブルで直接接続した群(Cable群),イメージングユニットに保存したデータをCEREC3ソフトウェアから送信した群,イメージングユニットに保存したデータをメールソフトウェアから送信した群とした.辺縁部,内面部セメント厚さとも3群間に有意差を認めなかった.Cable群が他の2群と比較して有意に小さいデータサイズを示したが,インターネットを介した2群間に有意差を認めなかった.修復物の重量および大きさは,3群間に有意差を認めなかった

publisher.ja: クインテッセンス出版(株)
